unnormalised: Real Estate Buzz: Nailing That Rental Agreement, Bhai!
normalised: Real Estate Buzz: Nailing That Rental Agreement, Brother!

unnormalised: So, you've found your dream pad in Bandra, Mumbai? Congrats! But hold your horses before popping the celebratory chai. That rental agreement? It's crucial.
normalised: So, you've found your dream pad in Bandra, Mumbai? Congratulations! But hold your horses before popping the celebratory chai. That rental agreement? It's crucial.

unnormalised: Word on the street is landlords are getting stricter. Forget the old, scribbled-on-paper agreements. Think proper legal docs. Clauses about maintenance – who fixes the leaky tap, eh? – and security deposit (Rs. 50,000 might be the norm these days!) are key.
normalised: Word on the street is landlords are getting stricter. Forget the old, scribbled on paper agreements. Think proper legal documents. Clauses about maintenance – who fixes the leaky tap, e h? – and security deposit (rupee fifty thousand might be the norm these days!) are key.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, our property guru, advises double-checking the lock-in period. Imagine being stuck paying rent for 11 months in a 600 sq ft apartment you hate! Yikes! Also, understand the escalation clause – expect a rent hike after the first year, usually around 5-10%.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, our property guru, advises double checking the lock in period. Imagine being stuck paying rent for eleven months in a six hundred square feet apartment you hate! Yikes! Also, understand the escalation clause – expect a rent hike after the first year, usually around five to ten percent.

unnormalised: Remember that verbal agreement about painting the walls? Get it in writing! And while you're at it, photocopy your Aadhar card for verification. Landlords love that. Avoid surprises, protect yourself, and get that rental agreement ironclad. Happy renting!
normalised: Remember that verbal agreement about painting the walls? Get it in writing! And while you're at it, photocopy your Aadhar card for verification. Landlords love that. Avoid surprises, protect yourself, and get that rental agreement ironclad. Happy renting!
